info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 2:25AM CDT by NWS Green Bay WI
info.description:
At 224 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Glidden to 6 miles north of Prentice to near Gilbert. Movement was northeast at 30 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible.
Strong thunderstorms will be near... Tomahawk, Tripoli, and Gilbert around 230 AM CDT. Willow Lake around 240 AM CDT. Harrison and Willow Reservoir around 250 AM CDT. Woodboro around 255 AM CDT. Rhinelander and Lac Du Flambeau around 300 AM CDT. Squirrel Lake around 305 AM CDT.
Other locations impacted by these storms include Sayner, Bradley, Lower Tomahawk River Natural Area, Harshaw, Hazelhurst, Mccord, Otter Lake Campground, Jeffris, Goodnow, and Trout Lake.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.

parameter.value: STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHERN LINCOLN...WESTERN VILAS AND ONEIDA COUNTIES THROUGH 315 AM CDT
